search_results.snippet: Macaque Monkeys. Macaques live in many different habitats across the globe, making them the most widely distributed genus of nonhuman primates. Macaques (especially Macaca mulatta and M. fascicularis) are commonly used in researchmost recently in AIDS research. Their coloration includes gray, brown or black fur.
